title: BTD Streetscape Changes

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

pertaining to data gathering, analysis, and community engagement conducted for Roslindale Square by the Boston Transportation Department (BTD), Open Box, and any other consultants or partner organizations since January 1, 2024:

I -Reports and Deliverables
A. Any reports, including but not limited to:
    1. Survey instruments, responses, and tabulated data summaries
    2. Interim or final reports
    3. Memos
    4. Slide presentations
    5. Findings prepared by Open Box, BTD, or other consultants related to Roslindale Square

II - Public Participation Records
A. All materials and data associated with public engagement efforts, including but not limited to:
    1. Invitations, flyers, agendas, meeting minutes, slide decks, recordings, and handouts
    2. Screening criteria and methods
    3. Focus group interview guide
    4. Individual interview guide
    5. Number of individual participants and how identified
    6. Number of organizational participants and how identified
    7. Demographic breakdowns of participants (where collected), including but not limited to:
        a. Age
        b. Race/ethnicity
        c. Language
        d. Neighborhood
        e. Whether or not a business owner, and business information including but not limited to:
            i. Type of business
            ii. Business address
            iii. Duration of business presence in Roslindale Square
    8. Survey or feedback responses categorized by:
        a. Demographic information
        b. Geographic information
         c.  Roslindale Business Owner status (yes/no)

III - Methods used to ensure equitable outreach and engagement

IV - Organizational Participation
A. Records identifying organizations that participated in public engagement or stakeholder processes, including but not limited to:
    1. Organization names, number of representatives involved, and event dates
    2. Role or type of participation (focus group, listening session, steering committee, etc.)
    3. Contact person (name, title, email) for each participating organization (where available)
    4. Any formal or informal feedback or written submissions provided by these organizations

V - Correspondence
A. Email or written correspondence between BTD staff (including Directors), Chief of Streets, Open Box, Roslindale Village Main Streets, WalkUP Roslindale, Abundant Housing, Rozzidents for More Rozzidents, including but not limited to: Anna VanRemoortel, Laura Charles, Emma Blaxter, Alyssa MacNeill, Courtney Pong, Matthew Lawlor, Benjamin Bruno, Andrew Murray, Nate Stell, Elvira Moira or others regarding Roslindale Square, particularly where engagement methods, community data, or equity analysis were discuss
Consultant Engagement and Contracts
A. All contracts, scopes of work, MOUs, RFQs, and procurement documentation relating to the engagement of Open Box or other external consultants for work on the Roslindale Square assessment

VI -Data Collection and Analysis
A. All raw and processed data collected on transportation, traffic, pedestrian movement, parking, public space use, and effects on small businesses in Roslindale Square, including but not limited to:
    1. Camera footage, sensor logs, pedestrian/vehicle counts, and associated metadata
    2. GIS files, maps, and visualizations (e.g., heat maps, mobility models)

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rosaline Russ

title: University of Tennessee, Knoxville - Calls to fire staff member over Trump post

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: University of Tennessee, Knoxville - Calls to fire staff member over Trump post
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any communications (defined below) to or from any of the UT OFFICIALS (identified below) which (a) relate to Beth Hall Davis; (b) relate to Beth Hall Davis' social media post; or (c) otherwise mention any of the following terms: Beth, Davis, Facebook, Trump, Brent, Taylor, Senator, Twitter, DeAngelis, Holocaust, Germany, ICE, Starnes. This request is limited to communications sent or received on June 11, 2025, and/or June 12, 2025.

2. Any communications (defined below) between any of the UT OFFICIALS (defined below) and any elected official, including (but not limited to) Brent Taylor, or the staff members, aides, or offices of any elected official, on June 11, 2025, and/or June 12, 2025.

3. Any records reflecting the phone call or conversation between Randy Boyd and Brent Taylor on June 11, 2025.

UT OFFICIALS means and includes any and/or all of the following personnel or offices: Randy Boyd, Tiffany Carpenter, Donde Plowman, the UT System Office of State Relations, Carey Whitworth, Tim Sigler, Josh Warren, Annie Freeland Fishel, and Gwen Hopkins.

"Communications" means and includes emails, text messages, social media messages, letters, memoranda, calendar entries, chats, or any other form of one-to-one or one-to-many communication.

Please note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on devices or networks owned or operated by private parties. For example, if an employee uses a personal cell phone or social media account to conduct public business, records created, maintained, or held on the phone or account are public records subject to this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Adam Steinbaugh.

title: Documents from the Planning and Early Days of the Wyatt Detention Facility (Mentioned in 2002 Harvard Design School Paper)

communications.subject: Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act Request: Documents from the Planning and Early Days of the Wyatt Detention Facility (Mentioned in 2002 Harvard Design School Paper)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A number of documents related to the planning, launch, and early operations of the Wyatt Detention Facility that are mentioned in the publicly available 20-page Harvard Design School paper on the Wyatt from 2002. That case study, authored by HSD graduate student, Arjan Bol, can be found here: https://www.dunwalke.com/resources/documents/Events/Harvard_Case_Study_940101-014.pdf.

The documents I am seeking include:

-The prospectus for the Donald W. Wyatt Detention Facility. (Mentioned in the “Sources” section of Bol's paper on page 20.)

-The final plans for the Donald W. Wyatt Detention Facility. (Mentioned in the “City Approval” section on page 9, in a sentence that reads, in part, “In July 1991, the final plans were presented to the residents and the City Council of Central Falls…”)

-The March 2, 1992 Loan and Trust Agreement between the Rhode Island Port Authority and the Central Falls Detention Facility Corporation. (Mentioned in the “Loan and Trust Agreement” section on page 11, in a sentence that reads, in part, “…on March 2, 1992, the Board approved the ‘Loan and Trust Agreement’ between the Rhode Island Port Authority and the Central Falls Detention Facility Corporation.”)

-The August 19, 1991 Intergovernmental Agreement between the U.S. Marshals Service and the Central Falls Detention Facility Corporation. (Mentioned in the “Intergovernmental Agreement” section on pages 13 and 14, in a sentence that reads, in part, “…resulting in the signing of the Intergovernmental Agreement on August 19, 1991 between the Central Falls Detention Facility Corporation and the United States of America, acting for and through the US Marshal Service.”)

-The November 1, 1991 report by consultants Arthur Andersen & Co. (Mentioned in the “The Arthur Andersen report” section on page 14, in sentences that read, “Cornell Cox hired the prestigious consulting firm, Arthur Andersen & Co., to estimate the need for detention bed space. The Andersen report, dated November 1, 1991…”)

-The August 1991 design-build contract with Brown & Root for the construction of the Wyatt Detention Facility. (Mentioned in the “Design-Build contract” section on page 15, in a sentence that reads, “In August 1991, CFDFC signed a design-build contract with a fixed price of US $21.2 million (including acquisition costs) with Brown & Root.”)

-The Wyatt Detention Facility Operator’s Agreement signed by Cornell Cox. (Mentioned in the “Operator's Agreement” section on page 16, in a sentence that reads, “Cornell Cox signed a contract with CFDFC to operate and manage the detention facility.”)

-The Detention Center Associates’ consulting agreement for the Wyatt Detention Facility. (Mentioned in the “Consulting Agreement” section on page 16, in a sentence that reads, “DCA, involved in the project from the beginning, signed a one-year consulting contract with CFDFC.”)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Philip Eil

title: Materials from the Wyatt Detention Facility’s Ten-Year Anniversary Celebration on July 18, 2003

communications.subject: Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act Request: Materials from the Wyatt Detention Facility’s Ten-Year Anniversary Celebration on July 18, 2003
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any materials related to the Wyatt Detention Facility’s Ten-Year Anniversary Celebration luncheon held at Pawtucket Country Club on July 18, 2003. This includes:

-Photographs of the event.

-Written materials related to the event, including plans, guest lists, invitations, menus, programs, and prepared remarks.

-A video that was shown at the event, described in the facility’s 2003 annual report as “a specially prepared video program highlighting the major milestones over the past ten years [which] gave viewers an opportunity to become aware of both the economic and criminal justice benefits and contributions the Wyatt has made.”

-Any other printed or multimedia documents related to the event.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Philip Eil

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The 2023 annual budget report for the Office of Public Affairs of the Central Intelligence Agency.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

Brett Carollo

This is to acknowledge receipt of your 12-Jun-25, Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request for "the following records:The 2023 annual budget report for the Public Affairs Agency of the U.S. Air Force." (Date Range for Record Search: From 01/01/2014 To 06/12/2025). Based on our initial review, we believe we cannot process your request within the statutory 20 workdays because our organization has a significant number of pending FOIA requests.  To ensure all requesters are properly served in the order their requests were received, we have instituted multitrack processing of requests.  Based on the information you provided, we have placed your request in the complex track. The Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) provides for the collection of fees based on the costs of processing a FOIA request and your fee category.  Based upon the information provided in your request, we have placed you in the Other category.  Regarding your request for a fee waiver, we defer regarding this, or any subsequent fee issue until the review of responsive records is complete.  At that time you will be contacted relative to fees. We have assigned number 2025-05896-F to identify your request; should you need to contact us about your request.  Please direct your questions to SAF.AA.HAF.FOIA.Workflow@us.af.mil and use this assigned number to assist us in responding more promptly. We will strive to provide an update between 90 and 120 days.  Our policy is to process requests within their respective tracks in the order in which they were received in accordance with 32 CFR, Part 286.8.  We will notify you in writing if additional processing time is required.  We do process each FOIA request as quickly as possible, however delayed responses can be expected. Very Respectfully, HAF FOIA TEAM SAF/AAII (FOIA) Office of the Secretary of the Air Force 1000 Air Force Pentagon Washington, DC 20330-1000

title: ARIZONA DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION REQUEST

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Professional Mobility Research - Arizona Driver License Documentation

Requesting driver license records maintained by the Motor Vehicle Division for Justin Kashuba during Arizona residency period (approximately 1993-2002).


**Records requested:**
- Driver license applications, renewals, and photographs
- Complete driving record including citations and accidents
- Vehicle registration records for registered vehicles
- Address change history during Arizona residence


**Privacy Protection Request:**
Please redact date of birth and SSN from provided records while maintaining document integrity for research purposes which requires record content but not personal identifying information such as DOB and SSN.


**Research focuses on professional mobility patterns during career development and interstate documentation procedures. Academic study examines driver records as documentation of professional geographic mobility and civic compliance.**

**Fee waiver requested for academic research into professional mobility patterns and government documentation practices.**

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Justin Kashuba

title: Driver License History Research - Record Retention Policy Analysis

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

CONNECTICUT DMV REQUEST


Requesting driver license history and related records for Justin T Kashuba formerly of Derby and or Seymour CT, covering all available time-frames from original license and per permit issuance (approximately 1992-1993) through 1995.


**Records requested include:**

- Driver license applications and renewals
- Driving record and violation history if any
- Address documentation 
- Current retention policy for historical records


**Privacy Protection Request:**
Please redact date of birth and SSN if present from provided records while maintaining document integrity for research purposes. Research requires record content but not personal identifying information such as DOB and SSN.

**This request serves academic research into government record retention practices and interstate mobility documentation.**

**If records from the 1990s are no longer retained due to policy limitations, requesting available documentation from earliest retained period.


**Fee waiver requested for academic research into government record-keeping practices and institutional transparency and reasons listed below.**

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Justin Kashuba

title: Request to Marines for Personnel Record of Adam Driver

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the U.S. Marines Corps personnel records (OMPF) for a former servicemember named ADAM DOUGLAS DRIVER (DATE OF BIRTH: 11/19/1983). Mr. Driver was born in Fontana, California. He served in the U.S. Marines Corps from 2001 to 2004 and achieved the rank of lance corporal. The requested records include performance reports, job assessments, disciplinary records, training received, discharge papers, and any other releasable records.

I originally submitted this request to the National Personnel Records Center, which ordinarily handles these requests, but they claimed that they could locate no records for Mr. Driver. They forwarded the request to the Marines, who administratively closed my request after I did not respond to a denial letter (that I never personally received until after the closure) of my waiver of fees request. This is why I am sending the request directly to this office.

The public interest in Mr. Driver, an Academy Award-nominated film actor , should favor disclosure of many of these records, particularly in relation to any disciplinary records, should those records exist.

Please be sure to review and release any segregable information, even if certain documents or portions of documents are withheld.

PLEASE NOTE: I am not a next of kin of this servicemember, and thus do not know Mr. Driver’s Social Security Number. Because of this, I am ONLY requesting records releasable under the Freedom of Information Act. Please process my request for this servicemember's OMPF and other records under the Freedom of Information Act’s relevant provisions. I am not seeking any records that would be releasable under the Privacy Act.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: Public Records Request – 911 and Dispatch Activity Near AHOPE, Woods-Mullen Shelter, and Southampton Shelter

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Public Records Request – 911 and Dispatch Activity Near AHOPE, Woods-Mullen Shelter, and Southampton Shelter
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Records Access Officer,

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law (M.G.L. c. 66, § 10), I am requesting the following records:

1. Computer-Aided Dispatch (CAD) logs and 911 call records
From January 1, 2022 to present for all calls for service involving:

-774 Albany Street (AHOPE and SPOT)
-112 Southampton Street (Southampton Shelter)
-794 Massachusetts Avenue (Woods-Mullen Shelter)
-Albany Street corridor from Massachusetts Avenue to Southampton Street
-Intersections at:
-Albany St & Massachusetts Ave
-Albany St & East Lenox St
-Albany St & Southampton St
-Please include for each call:

-Date and time
-Nature or category of the call (including but not limited to: drug use, drug dealing, overdoses, narcotics possession, suspicious activity, assault, robbery, trespassing, loitering, public disturbances)
-Final disposition (e.g., report filed, arrest made, cleared, no action)
-Any associated case or incident number

2. Incident Reports
Please include redacted incident reports for drug activity, overdoses, assaults, threats, or other safety concerns at or near these addresses.

3. Internal Communications
All internal emails, memos, and  reports created between January 1, 2022 and the present involving any of the following personnel or offices:

Officers and supervisors in Boston Police District D-4, including but not limited to the District Captain, Shift Commanders, and Community Service Officers
Staff within the BPD Legal Division or Office of the Police Commissioner

Officials from the Mayor’s Office, Boston Public Health Commission, or Coordinated Response Team

Specifically regarding:

Patterns of drug activity, overdoses, or public safety concerns in the areas surrounding AHOPE (774 Albany St), Woods-Mullen Shelter (794 Mass Ave), and Southampton Shelter (112 Southampton St)

Decisions not to arrest, cite, or remove individuals for open drug use or dealing in the above zones

Coordination or conflict between harm reduction services and law enforcement

Public records requests, community complaints, or media inquiries involving these locations

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian McCarter

title: Army support for 2023 film "The Covenant"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Army support for 2023 film "The Covenant"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to collaboration between the U.S. Army and the production of the 2023 movie "The Covenant," directed by Guy Ritchie. I request any and all documents pertaining to DoD support for "The Covenant." Such documents may include but should not be limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; photographs; and all records of communications between employees of the Army and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "The Covenant," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

communications.communication:

Tracie McMillan
